pkgmetadata.longdescription: Maximum Likelihood Estimation for Probability Functions from Data Sets // Routines for parameter estimation for any probability density or mass function implemented in R via maximum likelihood (ML) given a data set. The main routines 'maxlogL' and 'maxlogLreg' are wrapper functions specifically developed for ML estimation. There are included optimization procedures such as 'nlminb' and 'optim' from base package, and 'DEoptim' Mullen (2011) doi: 10.18637/jss.v040.i06. Standard errors are estimated with 'numDeriv' Gilbert (2011) https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=numDeriv or the option 'Hessian = TRUE' of 'optim' function.
